Reservations.documentation: A list of all reservations that have been purchased by this account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the MediaConnect resource for which to list the tags.

Tags.documentation: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge.

Name.documentation: The name of the bridge.

PlacementArn.documentation: The ARN of the gateway associated with the bridge.

ListedBridge.documentation: Displays details of the selected bridge.

DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent.documentation: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

ListedEntitlement.documentation: An entitlement that has been granted to you from other Amazon Web Services accounts.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone that the flow was created in.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow.

Name.documentation: The name of the flow.

SourceType.documentation: The type of source. This value is either owned (originated somewhere other than an MediaConnect flow owned by another Amazon Web Services account) or entitled (originated at a MediaConnect flow owned by another Amazon Web Services account).

Status.documentation: The current status of the flow.

Maintenance.documentation: The maintenance settings for the flow.

ListedFlow.documentation: A summary of a flow, including its ARN, Availability Zone, and source type.

GatewayArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.

Name.documentation: The name of the gateway.

ListedGateway.documentation: A summary of a gateway, including its name, ARN, and status.

GatewayArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.

GatewayInstanceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.

InstanceId.documentation: The managed instance ID generated by the SSM install. This will begin with "mi-".

MaintenanceDay.documentation: A day of a week when the maintenance will happen. Use Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday/Friday/Saturday/Sunday.

MaintenanceDeadline.documentation: The Maintenance has to be performed before this deadline in ISO UTC format. Example: 2021-01-30T08:30:00Z.

MaintenanceScheduledDate.documentation: A scheduled date in ISO UTC format when the maintenance will happen. Use YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2021-01-30.

MaintenanceStartHour.documentation: UTC time when the maintenance will happen. Use 24-hour HH:MM format. Minutes must be 00. Example: 13:00. The default value is 02:00.

Maintenance.documentation: The maintenance setting of a flow.

Attributes.documentation: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

ClockRate.documentation: The sample rate for the stream. This value is measured in Hz.

Description.documentation: A description that can help you quickly identify what your media stream is used for.

Fmt.documentation: The format type number (sometimes referred to as RTP payload type) of the media stream. MediaConnect assigns this value to the media stream. For ST 2110 JPEG XS outputs, you need to provide this value to the receiver.

MediaStreamId.documentation: A unique identifier for the media stream.

MediaStreamName.documentation: A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

MediaStream.documentation: A media stream represents one component of your content, such as video, audio, or ancillary data. After you add a media stream to your flow, you can associate it with sources and outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS or CDI protocol.

Fmtp.documentation: The settings that you want to use to define the media stream.

Lang.documentation: The audio language, in a format that is recognized by the receiver.

MediaStreamAttributes.documentation: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

Fmtp.documentation: The settings that you want to use to define the media stream.

Lang.documentation: The audio language, in a format that is recognized by the receiver.

MediaStreamAttributesRequest.documentation: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

DestinationConfigurations.documentation: The transport parameters that are associated with each outbound media stream.

EncodingName.documentation: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

EncodingParameters.documentation: A collection of parameters that determine how MediaConnect will convert the content. These fields only apply to outputs on flows that have a CDI source.

MediaStreamName.documentation: The name of the media stream.

MediaStreamOutputConfiguration.documentation: The media stream that is associated with the output, and the parameters for that association.

DestinationConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that you want to associate with the output.

EncodingName.documentation: The format that will be used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

EncodingParameters.documentation: A collection of parameters that determine how MediaConnect will convert the content. These fields only apply to outputs on flows that have a CDI source.

MediaStreamName.documentation: The name of the media stream that is associated with the output.

MediaStreamOutputConfigurationRequest.documentation: The media stream that you want to associate with the output, and the parameters for that association.

EncodingName.documentation: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

InputConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that you want to associate with the source.

MediaStreamName.documentation: A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

MediaStreamSourceConfiguration.documentation: The media stream that is associated with the source, and the parameters for that association.

EncodingName.documentation: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

InputConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that you want to associate with the source.

MediaStreamSourceConfigurationRequest.documentation: The media stream that you want to associate with the source, and the parameters for that association.

Message.documentation: The specific error message that MediaConnect returns to help you understand the reason that the request did not succeed.

Errors.documentation: A list of errors that might have been generated from processes on this flow.

Messages.documentation: Messages that provide the state of the flow.

ThumbnailState.documentation: Indicates whether thumbnails are enabled or disabled.

AudioMonitoringSettings.documentation: Contains the settings for audio stream metrics monitoring.

ContentQualityAnalysisState.documentation: Indicates whether content quality analysis is enabled or disabled.

VideoMonitoringSettings.documentation: Contains the settings for video stream metrics monitoring.

MulticastSourceIp.documentation: The IP address of the source for source-specific multicast (SSM).

MulticastSourceSettings.documentation: The settings related to the multicast source.

NdiState.documentation: A setting that controls whether NDI outputs can be used in the flow. Must be ENABLED to add NDI outputs. Default is DISABLED.

MachineName.documentation: A prefix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect generates a unique 12-character ID as the prefix.

NdiDiscoveryServers.documentation: A list of up to three NDI discovery server configurations. While not required by the API, this configuration is necessary for NDI functionality to work properly.

NdiConfig.documentation: Specifies the configuration settings for NDI outputs. Required when the flow includes NDI outputs.

DiscoveryServerAddress.documentation: The unique network address of the NDI discovery server.

DiscoveryServerPort.documentation: The port for the NDI discovery server. Defaults to 5959 if a custom port isn't specified.

VpcInterfaceAdapter.documentation: The identifier for the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network interface used by the flow.

NdiDiscoveryServerConfig.documentation: Specifies the configuration settings for individual NDI discovery servers. A maximum of 3 servers is allowed.

NotFoundException.documentation: One or more of the resources in the request does not exist in the system.

CurrencyCode.documentation: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for all reservations is US dollars.

Duration.documentation: The length of time that your reservation would be active.

DurationUnits.documentation: The unit of measurement for the duration of the offering.

OfferingArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.

PricePerUnit.documentation: The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate.

PriceUnits.documentation: The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate.

ResourceSpecification.documentation: A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering.

Offering.documentation: A savings plan that reserves a certain amount of outbound bandwidth usage at a discounted rate each month over a period of time.

DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent.documentation: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

Destination.documentation: The address where you want to send the output.

Encryption.documentation: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

EntitlementArn.documentation: The ARN of the entitlement on the originator''s flow. This value is relevant only on entitled flows.

ListenerAddress.documentation: The IP address that the receiver requires in order to establish a connection with the flow. For public networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic IP address of the flow. For private networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic network interface IP address of the VPC. This field applies only to outputs that use the Zixi pull or SRT listener protocol.

MediaLiveInputArn.documentation: The input ARN of the MediaLive channel. This parameter is relevant only for outputs that were added by creating a MediaLive input.

MediaStreamOutputConfigurations.documentation: The configuration for each media stream that is associated with the output.

Name.documentation: The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.

Port.documentation: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

Transport.documentation: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the output.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge added to this output.

BridgePorts.documentation: The bridge output ports currently in use.

OutputStatus.documentation: An indication of whether the output is transmitting data or not.

PeerIpAddress.documentation:
The IP address of the device that is currently receiving content from this output.

  • For outputs that use protocols where you specify the destination (such as SRT Caller or Zixi Push), this value matches the configured destination address.

  • For outputs that use listener protocols (such as SRT Listener), this value shows the address of the connected receiver.

  • Peer IP addresses aren't available for entitlements, managed MediaLive outputs, NDI outputs, and CDI/ST2110 outputs.

  • The peer IP address might not be visible for flows that haven't been started yet, or flows that were started before May 2025. In these cases, restart your flow to see the peer IP address.

OfferingArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the offering.

ReservationName.documentation: The name that you want to use for the reservation.

Start.documentation:
The date and time that you want the reservation to begin, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

You can specify any date and time between 12:00am on the first day of the current month to the current time on today's date, inclusive. Specify the start in a 24-hour notation. Use the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ, where T and Z are literal characters. For example, to specify 11:30pm on March 5, 2020, enter 2020-03-05T23:30:00Z.

Reservation.documentation: The details of the reservation that you just created when you purchased the offering.

BridgeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update.

OutputName.documentation: The name of the bridge output that you want to remove.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge from which the output was removed.

OutputName.documentation: The name of the bridge output that was removed.

BridgeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update.

SourceName.documentation: The name of the bridge source that you want to remove.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge from which the source was removed.

SourceName.documentation: The name of the bridge source that was removed.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to update.

MediaStreamName.documentation: The name of the media stream that you want to remove.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that was updated.

MediaStreamName.documentation: The name of the media stream that was removed.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to remove an output from.

OutputArn.documentation: The ARN of the output that you want to remove.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that the output was removed from.

OutputArn.documentation: The ARN of the output that was removed.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to remove a source from.

SourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the source that you want to remove.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that the source was removed from.

SourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the source that was removed.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to remove a VPC interface from.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface that you want to remove.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the VPC interface you removed.

NonDeletedNetworkInterfaceIds.documentation: IDs of network interfaces associated with the removed VPC interface that MediaConnect was unable to remove.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface that was removed.

CurrencyCode.documentation: The type of currency that is used for billing. The currencyCode used for your reservation is US dollars.

Duration.documentation: The length of time that this reservation is active. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

DurationUnits.documentation: The unit of measurement for the duration of the reservation. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

End.documentation: The day and time that this reservation expires. This value is calculated based on the start date and time that you set and the offering's duration.

OfferingArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the offering.

OfferingDescription.documentation: A description of the offering. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

PricePerUnit.documentation: The cost of a single unit. This value, in combination with priceUnits, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

PriceUnits.documentation: The unit of measurement that is used for billing. This value, in combination with pricePerUnit, makes up the rate. MediaConnect defines this value in the offering.

ReservationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that MediaConnect assigns to the reservation when you purchase an offering.

ReservationName.documentation: The name that you assigned to the reservation when you purchased the offering.

ResourceSpecification.documentation: A definition of the amount of outbound bandwidth that you would be reserving if you purchase the offering. MediaConnect defines the values that make up the resourceSpecification in the offering.

Start.documentation: The day and time that the reservation becomes active. You set this value when you purchase the offering.

Reservation.documentation: A pricing agreement for a discounted rate for a specific outbound bandwidth that your MediaConnect account will use each month over a specific time period. The discounted rate in the reservation applies to outbound bandwidth for all flows from your account until your account reaches the amount of bandwidth in your reservation. If you use more outbound bandwidth than the agreed upon amount in a single month, the overage is charged at the on-demand rate.

ReservedBitrate.documentation: The amount of outbound bandwidth that is discounted in the offering.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of resource and the unit that is being billed for.

ResourceSpecification.documentation: A definition of what is being billed for, including the type and amount.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entitlement that you want to revoke.

FlowArn.documentation: The flow that you want to revoke an entitlement from.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The ARN of the entitlement that was revoked.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that the entitlement was revoked from.

ServiceUnavailableException.documentation: The service is currently unavailable or busy.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge feeding this flow.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this bridge source.

SetGatewayBridgeSourceRequest.documentation: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

Decryption.documentation: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source. Allowable encryption types: static-key.

Description.documentation: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current MediaConnect account.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to this flow. The entitlement is set by the flow originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

IngestPort.documentation: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

MaxBitrate.documentation: The smoothing max bitrate (in bps) for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

MaxLatency.documentation: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

MaxSyncBuffer.documentation: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

MediaStreamSourceConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that are associated with the source, and the parameters for those associations.

MinLatency.documentation: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

Name.documentation: The name of the source.

Protocol.documentation:
The protocol that is used by the source.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

SenderControlPort.documentation: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

SenderIpAddress.documentation: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

SourceListenerAddress.documentation: Source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

StreamId.documentation: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface to use for this source.

WhitelistCidr.documentation: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

GatewayBridgeSource.documentation: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

SetSourceRequest.documentation: The settings for the source of the flow.

State.documentation: Indicates whether the SilentAudio metric is enabled or disabled.

ThresholdSeconds.documentation: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of silence that triggers an event or alert.

DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent.documentation: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

Decryption.documentation: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.

Description.documentation: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current MediaConnect account.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to content that comes from another Amazon Web Services account. The entitlement is set by the content originator and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

IngestIp.documentation: The IP address that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

IngestPort.documentation: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

MediaStreamSourceConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that are associated with the source, and the parameters for those associations.

Name.documentation: The name of the source.

SenderControlPort.documentation: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

SenderIpAddress.documentation: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

Transport.documentation: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the source.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface that is used for this source.

WhitelistCidr.documentation: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

GatewayBridgeSource.documentation: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

PeerIpAddress.documentation:
The IP address of the device that is currently sending content to this source.

  • For sources that use protocols where you specify the origin (such as SRT Caller), this value matches the configured origin address.

  • For sources that use listener protocols (such as SRT Listener or RTP), this value shows the address of the connected sender.

  • Peer IP addresses aren't available for entitlements and CDI/ST2110 sources.

  • The peer IP address might not be visible for flows that haven't been started yet, or flows that were started before May 2025. In these cases, restart your flow to see the peer IP address.

Source.documentation: The settings for the source of the flow.

PrimarySource.documentation: The name of the source you choose as the primary source for this flow.

SourcePriority.documentation: The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to start.
The ARN of the flow that you started.

Status.documentation: The status of the flow when the StartFlow process begins.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to stop.
The ARN of the flow that you stopped.

Status.documentation: The status of the flow when the StopFlow process begins.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the MediaConnect resource to which to add tags.

Tags.documentation: A map from tag keys to values. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that DescribeFlowSourceThumbnail was performed on.

ThumbnailMessages.documentation: Status code and messages about the flow source thumbnail.

Timestamp.documentation: The timestamp of when thumbnail was generated.

ThumbnailDetails.documentation: The details of the thumbnail, including thumbnail base64 string, timecode and the time when thumbnail was generated.

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The request was denied due to request throttling.

CidrAllowList.documentation: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16

MaxBitrate.documentation: The smoothing max bitrate (in bps) for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

MaxLatency.documentation: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

MaxSyncBuffer.documentation: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

MinLatency.documentation: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

Protocol.documentation:
The protocol that is used by the source or output.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

RemoteId.documentation: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

SenderControlPort.documentation: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

SenderIpAddress.documentation: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

SmoothingLatency.documentation: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

SourceListenerAddress.documentation: Source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

StreamId.documentation: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

NdiSpeedHqQuality.documentation: A quality setting for the NDI Speed HQ encoder.

NdiProgramName.documentation: A suffix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect uses the output name.

Transport.documentation: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in a source or output.

Programs.documentation: The list of transport stream programs in the current flow's source.

TransportMediaInfo.documentation: The metadata of the transport stream in the current flow's source.

Channels.documentation: The number of channels in the audio stream.

Codec.documentation: The codec used by the stream.

FrameRate.documentation: The frame rate used by the video stream.

FrameResolution.documentation: The frame resolution used by the video stream.

Pid.documentation: The Packet ID (PID) as it is reported in the Program Map Table.

SampleRate.documentation: The sample rate used by the audio stream.

SampleSize.documentation: The sample bit size used by the audio stream.

StreamType.documentation: The Stream Type as it is reported in the Program Map Table.

TransportStream.documentation: The metadata of an elementary transport stream.

PcrPid.documentation: The Program Clock Reference (PCR) Packet ID (PID) as it is reported in the Program Association Table.

ProgramName.documentation: The program name as it is reported in the Program Association Table.

ProgramNumber.documentation: The program number as it is reported in the Program Association Table.

ProgramPid.documentation: The program Packet ID (PID) as it is reported in the Program Association Table.

Streams.documentation: The list of elementary transport streams in the program. The list includes video, audio, and data streams.

TransportStreamProgram.documentation: The metadata of a single transport stream program.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to untag.

TagKeys.documentation: The keys of the tags to be removed.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the MediaConnect resource from which to delete tags.

FlowVpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this source.

UpdateBridgeFlowSourceRequest.documentation: Update the flow source of the bridge.

Protocol.documentation:
The network output protocol.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

MulticastSourceSettings.documentation: The settings related to the multicast source.

Protocol.documentation:
The network source protocol.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

UpdateBridgeNetworkSourceRequest.documentation: Update the network source of the bridge.

BridgeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update.

NetworkOutput.documentation: The network of the bridge output.

OutputName.documentation: Tname of the output that you want to update.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge that was updated.

Output.documentation: The bridge output that was updated.

BridgeArn.documentation: TheAmazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update.

EgressGatewayBridge.documentation: A cloud-to-ground bridge. The content comes from an existing MediaConnect flow and is delivered to your premises.

IngressGatewayBridge.documentation: A ground-to-cloud bridge. The content originates at your premises and is delivered to the cloud.

BridgeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update.

FlowSource.documentation: The name of the flow that you want to update.

NetworkSource.documentation: The network for the bridge source.

SourceName.documentation: The name of the source that you want to update.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the updated bridge source.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bridge that you want to update the state of.

DesiredState.documentation: The desired state for the bridge.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the updated bridge.

DesiredState.documentation: The new state of the bridge.

Algorithm.documentation: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

ConstantInitializationVector.documentation: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

DeviceId.documentation: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

KeyType.documentation: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

Region.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

ResourceId.documentation: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

SecretArn.documentation: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

Url.documentation: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

UpdateEncryption.documentation: Information about the encryption of the flow.

FailoverMode.documentation: The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams.

RecoveryWindow.documentation: Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets.

SourcePriority.documentation: The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams.

State.documentation: The state of source failover on the flow. If the state is inactive, the flow can have only one source. If the state is active, the flow can have one or two sources.

Description.documentation: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.

Encryption.documentation: The type of encryption that will be used on the output associated with this entitlement. Allowable encryption types: static-key, speke.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entitlement that you want to update.

EntitlementStatus.documentation: An indication of whether you want to enable the entitlement to allow access, or disable it to stop streaming content to the subscriber’s flow temporarily. If you don’t specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the entitlement that you want to update.

Subscribers.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.

Entitlement.documentation: The new configuration of the entitlement that you updated.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that this entitlement was granted on.

Attributes.documentation: The attributes that you want to assign to the media stream.

ClockRate.documentation: The sample rate for the stream. This value in measured in kHz.

Description.documentation: A description that can help you quickly identify what your media stream is used for.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that is associated with the media stream that you updated.

MediaStreamName.documentation: The media stream that you updated.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the media stream that you updated.

CidrAllowList.documentation: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

Description.documentation: A description of the output. This description appears only on the MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the end user.

Destination.documentation: The IP address where you want to send the output.

Encryption.documentation: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key). Allowable encryption types: static-key.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that is associated with the output that you want to update.

MaxLatency.documentation: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

MediaStreamOutputConfigurations.documentation: The media streams that are associated with the output, and the parameters for those associations.

MinLatency.documentation: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

OutputArn.documentation: The ARN of the output that you want to update.

Port.documentation: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

Protocol.documentation:
The protocol to use for the output.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

RemoteId.documentation: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

SenderControlPort.documentation: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

SenderIpAddress.documentation: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

SmoothingLatency.documentation: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

StreamId.documentation: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

OutputStatus.documentation: An indication of whether the output should transmit data or not. If you don't specify the outputStatus field in your request, MediaConnect leaves the value unchanged.

NdiProgramName.documentation: A suffix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect uses the output name.

NdiSpeedHqQuality.documentation: A quality setting for the NDI Speed HQ encoder.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that is associated with the updated output.

Output.documentation: The new settings of the output that you updated.

FlowArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to update.

Maintenance.documentation: The maintenance setting of the flow.

NdiConfig.documentation: Specifies the configuration settings for NDI outputs. Required when the flow includes NDI outputs.

Decryption.documentation: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from the source.

Description.documentation: A description of the source. This description is not visible outside of the current Amazon Web Services account.

EntitlementArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to the flow. The entitlement is set by the content originator, and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that you want to update.

IngestPort.documentation: The port that the flow listens on for incoming content. If the protocol of the source is Zixi, the port must be set to 2088.

MaxBitrate.documentation: The maximum bitrate for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

MaxLatency.documentation: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

MaxSyncBuffer.documentation: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

MediaStreamSourceConfigurations.documentation: The media stream that is associated with the source, and the parameters for that association.

MinLatency.documentation: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender’s minimum latency and the receiver’s minimum latency.

Protocol.documentation:
The protocol that the source uses to deliver the content to MediaConnect.

Elemental MediaConnect no longer supports the Fujitsu QoS protocol. This reference is maintained for legacy purposes only.

SenderControlPort.documentation: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

SenderIpAddress.documentation: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

SourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the source that you want to update.

SourceListenerAddress.documentation: The source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

StreamId.documentation: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface that you want to send your output to.

WhitelistCidr.documentation: The range of IP addresses that are allowed to contribute content to your source. Format the IP addresses as a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

GatewayBridgeSource.documentation: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

FlowArn.documentation: The ARN of the flow that you was updated.

Source.documentation: The details of the sources that are assigned to the flow.

BridgeArn.documentation: The ARN of the bridge feeding this flow.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this bridge source.

UpdateGatewayBridgeSourceRequest.documentation: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

GatewayInstanceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway instance that you want to update.
The ARN of the instance that was updated.

MaxOutputs.documentation: The maximum number of expected outputs.

MaintenanceDay.documentation: A day of a week when the maintenance will happen.

MaintenanceScheduledDate.documentation: A scheduled date in ISO UTC format when the maintenance will happen. Use YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2021-01-30.

MaintenanceStartHour.documentation: UTC time when the maintenance will happen. Use 24-hour HH:MM format. Minutes must be 00. Example: 13:00. The default value is 02:00.

UpdateMaintenance.documentation: Update maintenance setting for a flow.

FrozenFrames.documentation: Detects video frames that have not changed.

VideoMonitoringSetting.documentation: Specifies the configuration for video stream metrics monitoring.

Name.documentation: Immutable and has to be a unique against other VpcInterfaces in this Flow.

NetworkInterfaceIds.documentation: IDs of the network interfaces created in customer's account by MediaConnect.

RoleArn.documentation: A role Arn MediaConnect can assume to create ENIs in your account.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.

SubnetId.documentation: Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow.

VpcInterface.documentation: The settings for a VPC source.

VpcInterfaceName.documentation: The name of the VPC interface to use for this resource.

VpcInterfaceAttachment.documentation: The settings for attaching a VPC interface to an resource.

Name.documentation: The name for the VPC interface. This name must be unique within the flow.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that you created when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted service.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: A virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic.

SubnetId.documentation: The subnet IDs that you want to use for your VPC interface. A range of IP addresses in your VPC. When you create your VPC, you specify a range of IPv4 addresses for the VPC in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16. This is the primary CIDR block for your VPC. When you create a subnet for your VPC, you specify the CIDR block for the subnet, which is a subset of the VPC CIDR block. The subnets that you use across all VPC interfaces on the flow must be in the same Availability Zone as the flow.

VpcInterfaceRequest.documentation: The details of the VPC interfaces that you want to add to the flow.

documentation:
Welcome to the Elemental MediaConnect API reference.

MediaConnect is a service that lets you ingest live video content into the cloud and distribute it to destinations all over the world, both inside and outside the Amazon Web Services cloud. This API reference provides descriptions, syntax, and usage examples for each of the actions and data types that are supported by MediaConnect.

Use the following links to get started with the MediaConnect API:

  • Actions: An alphabetical list of all MediaConnect API operations.

  • Data types: An alphabetical list of all MediaConnect data types.

  • Common parameters: Parameters that all operations can use.

  • Common errors: Client and server errors that all operations can return.
